Welcome to ci's documentation!¶

You can write some Info about your project here!

Contents¶

using a toctree you can make a table of contents

cooking¶

brewing.cooking.simmer(potion, duration)¶

Cooks the potion.

Updates simmer_duration and cooked attributes in the class instance.

potionPotion instance

The potion to be cooked.

durationint

How long to cook the potion for [hours].

brewing.cooking.stir(potion, direction)¶

Stirs the potion.

Updates colour in the class instance.

potionPotion instance

The potion to be stirred.

direction{'clockwise', 'anti-clockwise'} str

The direction in which the potions is to be stirred

potion_class¶

class brewing.potion_class.Potion(student_name)¶
add_ingredients(ingredients=None)¶

Add ingredients to the potion.

Updates ingredients and colour attributes in the class instance.

ingredientsarray_like, optional

A list of ingredients (str) to add to the potion.

setup(container=None, heat_source=None)¶

Add a container and/or heat_source to the potion.

Updates container and heat_source attributes in the class instance.

containerstr, optional

The name of the container to brew the potion in.

heat_sourcestr, optional

The name of the heat source used to cook the potions

brew_potions¶

This is a module level docstring

brewing.brew_potions.make_example_potion(student_name='ASPP student')¶

This function makes an example potion.

student_namestr, optional

by default "ASPP student"

potion

example potion

brewing.brew_potions.make_python_expert_potion(student_name)¶

This function makes a python expert potion.

student_name : str, optional

potion

example potion

The files - containers.py - ingredients.py - inspection.py still need to be documented!
